page.title: 12Didbrook Parish Church
page.content: {Didbrook}belonged for many years to {Hailes Abbey}near by. The dedication of church and parish to St.George may date from about 1347 when Edward III founded the Order of the Garter, about which time St.George seems to have replaced Edward the Confessor as Patron Saint of England. In 1451 {William Whitchurch,}monk of Hailes, became Vicar of Didbrook. He rebuilt the parish church, in the 15th. century Cotswold style. The tower contains five bells. The tower is "engaged" ie. built inside the west end of the nave, and not, as with most western towers, projecting out from the nave. As Didbrook church has no side aisles its north and south walls are supported on arches. Its other features are the open trussed rafter and queen-post roof of the nave.
